rule: The output must only include the name of the category without any additional text, explanation, or context.
input: Political tensions rise over disputed territories
validityText:
The input "Political tensions rise over disputed territories" is a string, which satisfies the requirement that the input must be a string.

The content of the input appears to discuss political issues, which could be related to international politics or similar matters that tie into geopolitical issues. The specification requires the text to fall into one of the specified categories: World, Sports, Business, Sci/Tech. The topic involving "political tensions" over "disputed territories" can certainly fall under the World category, as such topics are often discussed in international news and concern world affairs.

Thus, based on the analysis, I conclude that the input complies with the specification as it is a string and represents a news-related topic that falls under the World category.

OK
coverageEvalText:
No violation. The chatbot output "World" is a classification of a news article that matches one of the categories provided in the description.

OK
